Pre-Game Insights: Tyrese Haliburton has an over/under of 17.5 points, which is slightly higher than his season average of 17.4 points per game.
Pascal Siakam is averaging 19.9 ppg this season and is favored to go over 18.5 points.
Jayson Tatum is having an MVP-caliber season, averaging 28.7 ppg this season.
Jaylen Brown scored a season-high 44 points on Friday against the Pacers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers-Celtics game is scheduled to take place at the TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts at 6:00 p.m. ET.
It will be televised locally on FanDuel Sports Network Indiana and NBC Sports Boston.
Fans can also watch it via live stream on NBA League Pass and FuboTV, which are paid subscriptions.
The Boston Celtics are the overwhelming favorites to win Sunday's game against the Indiana Pacers.
The prediction is an easy win for the Celtics, with the total score likely going over 233.5 points.
Others: The Pacers won the first meeting 135-132 in overtime on Oct. 30 before the Celtics got their revenge on Dec. 27 with a dominating 142-105 victory.
The Pacers currently sit eighth in the East standings with a 15-17 record.
The Celtics defeated the Pacers with ease on Friday, but they should expect a better fight tonight.
The Pacers have now lost two in a row after going on a five-game winning streak from Dec. 13 to Dec. 23.
